Name: Priscila Brandão de Aguilar ("Tiffany")
Description:
Priscila was shot nine times by two young men. She was a sex worker, working in the area of Rua Piauí.

The police suspect  24 year-old Fernando Túlio Miranda Lage (Pimpolho), a drug boss, and a 17 year-old adolescent to have committed the crime. A third man might also have been involved.

‘Transrespect versus Transphobia Worldwide’ research project: Super Noticia, online portal, 3.3.2011, 4.3.2011, Noticias Terra, 4.4.2011

Name: Val (Valdecir) das Graças Souza
Description:
Val was a sex worker. She was killed in the early morning with four gunshots shortly after she was seen leaving with a client on a motorbike.

‘Transrespect versus Transphobia Worldwide’ research project: Radio Cultura Foz, online portal, 6.03.2011

Name: Andrea
Description:
Andrea fell into a ravine, and public authorities impeded her rescue by community members. As a result, she was washed away by the current. According to the human rights organization Personeria de Medellin it was a murder.

‘Transrespect versus Transphobia Worldwide’ research project: Personeria de Medellin, Boletin de Prensa No. 159, 21.10.2011

Name: Casandra (Samuel Oliva Bautista)
Description:
Casandra worked at a bar. She was beaten to death with a hard object after she had been seen leaving the bar. Her body was found near a streat in Cunduacan. Her family suspect the crime was committed by Casandra's partner, who had severly injured her in January 2011.

TvT partner organization TV Mex - Travestis Mexico, Summary 2011; Tabasco Hoy, online portal, 9.3.2011

Name: Marcel Camero Tye
Description:
Marcel was found dead on the highway. She had been shot and dragged beneath a vehicle.

> Marcel Camero Tye, a 25-year-old transgender woman in Arkansas, was murdered over a year ago, but despite criticism from local advoctes, investigators say they haven't stopped looking for her killer even though the case is cold. According to a new report on KTHV, Tye was found on Highway 334 in St. Francis County, Ark., in March 2011. She had been shot to death and, most likely, dragged beneath a vehicle as the killer fled the scene.
>
> Sheriff Bobby May of St. Francis County told KTHV that the FBI ruled that the murder was not a hate crime, but all the evidence the police department has gathered, including plaster impressions of tire tracks, DNA, and shell casings, has led nowhere. Tye's murder and lack of a hate crime designation has been debated on local message boards (including one message from a friend of Tye's who said the victim was "picked on by police, schoolmates, and strangers," would never get into a car with a stranger, and would tell anyone propositioning her that she was transgender). But even with all that talk online, police say nobody has been talking with them and the even their best evidence is useless.

‘Transrespect versus Transphobia Worldwide’ research project: CBS News, 09.03.2011

https://www.advocate.com/crime/2012/05/12/police-arkansas-search-killer-trans-woman

https://arktimes.com/arkansas-blog/2011/03/10/forrest-city-death-possible-hate-crime-update

https://www.cbsnews.com/news/transgender-woman-killed-found-shot-dragged-say-ark-police/

https://unfinishedlivesblog.com/2011/03/20/two-transgender-murders-bespeak-crisis-of-violence/

https://www.motherjones.com/politics/2011/03/hate-crime-designation-arkansas/

Name: Shakira (Faizal Harahap)
Description:
The victim and two other transgender women were shot by two unidentified assailants in a red light district who fired shots at agroup of transgender people.

The other two transgender women survived.

‘Transrespect versus Transphobia Worldwide’ research project: Jakarta Post, 10.03.2011 & 17.04.2011

Name: Tininha (Roncon)
Description:
Tininha was reportedly in the company of a lover, the travesti Marcia on the day she was killed. As nothing was stolen, the police discarded robbery as the motif of the crime.

‘Transrespect versus Transphobia Worldwide’ research project: O Atibaiense, 16.03.2011

Name: Name Unknown
Description:
The victim was shot four times by an unknown person on a motorbike.

‘Transrespect versus Transphobia Worldwide’ research project: O Liberal, online portal, 12.03.2011

Name: La Jenny (Michel Ruiz Lopez)
Description:
La Jenny was found dead on the night of the 12th in her own apartment. She was strangled with a fabric belt. The police suspected that La Jennys partner, another travesti or her partner could have committed the crime, however without any substantive indications.

‘Transrespect versus Transphobia Worldwide’ research project: Diario de Quintana Roo, 16.3.2011

Name: R. Suresh
Location: Angala Parameswari Amman Temple, Chennai, Tamil Nadu
Description:
The victim was killed by a man, she met at a temple festival and with whom she went to an isolated place.

‘Transrespect versus Transphobia Worldwide’ research project: The Hindu, 19.03.2011

Name: Name Unknown
Description:
The victim was found near a bus station. According to witnesses, the victim was asked to come to that place and then clubbed to death.

‘Transrespect versus Transphobia Worldwide’ research project: JC Online 17.03.2009

Name: Andrea
Description:
Andrea was a sex worker and killed by a passer-by.

TvT partner organization: Observatorio Ciudadano Trans

Name: Name Unknown
Description:
The victim was shot four times in the head and back during daytime. According to witnesses, a man fired shots from a motorbike and fled the scene.

TvT partner organization TV Mex - Travestis Mexico, Summary 2011; Universogay, online portal, 18.3.2011

Name: (Javier Ortega Rodriguez)
Description:
The vicitm was a well-known stylist. Relatives had found the body after they had forcefully entered the victim's apartment, who had not responded. The police assume it was a robbery.

TvT partner organization TV Mex - Travestis Mexico, Summary 2011; A.M., online portal, 19.3.2011

Name: Name Unknown
Description:
The victim was shot to death point-blank along with a man.

TvT partner organization TV Mex - Travestis Mexico, Summary 2011; El Mexicano, online portal, 19.3.2011

Name: (Osimar Sebastião de Souza Júnior)
Description:
The victim's body was found by firemen on a street in the neighbourhood of Novo Horizonte. The victim died when entering into hospital.

‘Transrespect versus Transphobia Worldwide’ research project: Serra da Aguas, online portal, 23.03.2011

Name: (Marcos Jose Pereira da Silva)
Description:
The victim was a sex worker. She was tortured, together with her partner Jaime, for around one hour inside their own apartment. They were subsequently dragged outside and shot several times. Jaime managed to escape and survived with two shots in the arm. According to the victim's mother, who lives nearby, six men and two women had entered their apartment after breaking the door.

‘Transrespect versus Transphobia Worldwide’ research project: Folha de Pernambuco, online portal, March 2011

Name: S. P.
Description:
The victim was found dead on a street with her legs and head cut off from her body.

TvT partner organisation: Pembe Hayat (Pink Life), Ankara

Name: Name Unknown
Description:
The victim's body was found in a deserted area. The deth resulted from severe blows on the head with a hard object.

TvT partner organization TV Mex - Travestis Mexico, Summary 2011; Diario de Morelos, online journal, 24.3.2011

Name: Name Unknown
Description:
The victim's body was found in the sector of Tubo in Bello Oriente. The victim was about 17 to 20 years old.

‘Transrespect versus Transphobia Worldwide’ research project: Personeria de Medellin, Boletin de Prensa No. 159, 21.10.2011

Name: Jessica
Description:
Jessica was a sex worker. According to colleagues, she was on the street with other sex workers when a person came near and called her. As Jessica went over, the person stabbed her with a knife three times and fled. Her colleagues brought her to hospital, where she reportedly was not provided immediate treatment and died.

‘Transrespect versus Transphobia Worldwide’ research project: La Voz, online journal, 27.3.2011

Name: Leidy Garcia
Description:
The victim was of Ecuadorian descent.

‘Transrespect versus Transphobia Worldwide’ research project: El Tiempo 30.03.2011

Name: Brenda Vanessa Viveros Peralta
Description:
Brenda was a stylist.

TvT partner organization: Observatorio Ciudadano Trans
